oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Fact Sheet, 1961
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Document gives a short history and status updated on Highlander through 1962, after the land and buildings were sold at auction. A list of Board of Directors and Sponsors is on page three.

This document notes that the school was found guilty on only three of the eighteen charges, for selling beer without a permit, operating an integrated school, and running the non-profit for personal gain. The brochure notes the Solicitor General Archibald Cox remarked that Highlander "is indeed making large contributions to both education and democracy, and the closing of the school would seem to be a heavy blow to the public interest."
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); Boards of directors; Auctions; Fieldwork; Civic leaders; Adult education
